answerText: acetylcholine[10] This type of acetylcholine receptor is present on skeletal muscle and neurons, as opposed to muscarinic receptors, which exist in the heart.
heading: ICCS |2014 | 7 | 11 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: An autoimmune condition in which there are antibodies to this substance's receptors is called Myasthenia Gravis.  [10] Name this neurotransmitter which carries signals across the neuromuscular junction. Sarin and other nerve agents block the enzyme that breaks it down.
